data.title: Housing Architecture in Belgrade 1950-1970
data.meta_description: Housing Architecture in Belgrade 1950-1970 - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Housing architecture in Belgrade between 1950-1980 saw the construction of large housing blocks in New Belgrade to accommodate thousands of residents. Planning standards introduced by the Yugoslav People's Army, which were above average, helped improve housing floor plans with more optimized functional zones. Architects in New Belgrade had more freedom in their designs, which helped develop advanced organizational schemes within the housing units. Studies by the Housing Centre of the Institute for Testing Materials in Belgrade informed the scientific, interdisciplinary approach to planning living spaces based on peoples' habits. In particular, the text discusses two housing blocks - Block 21 and Block 23 - built in New Belgrade in the 1950s-60s that implemented higher standards than other parts of Yugosl
